Pet minut za čisto mikrovalovno pečico
Ker v mikrovalovki pripravljate številne jedi, se v njej hitro pojavijo madeži, ki pa so nepremagljivi le na prvi pogled.
01 Nov 2019, 17:57 by M. F.
Mikrovalovka je koristen gospodinjski pripomoček, v notranjosti katerega pa med pripravo ali pogrevanjem jedi nastajajo madeži, ki povzročajo nemalo preglavic. A v resnici niso tako trdovratni, kot se zdi. S pravimi pripomočki bodo premagljivi brez težav.
Mogočna limona
Pri nepogrešljiv je limona.  V posodo, ki je primerna za uporabo v mikrovalovki, nalijte vodo in ji dodajte na rezine narezan sadež.Vse skupaj do vretja segrevajte v pečici in v njej pustite še nekaj minut, da para začne mehčati madeže maščobe. Posodo nato odstranite in obrišite stene.Namesto limone lahko uporabite alkoholni kis. Voda in kis naj bosta v razmerju ena proti ena. Če madeži po prvem poskusu še ostanejo, postopek ponovite.
Jedilna soda in voda
Dobrodošla je tudi jedilna soda. V dva litra mlačne vode stresite štiri žlice prahu in z mešanico obrišite stene pečice. Za trdovratnejše madeže uporabite gostejšo pasto in jo pustite učinkovati nekaj minut, nato pa splaknite in notranjost naprave do suhega obrišite.

Five minutes for a clean microwave
Because you make many dishes in the microwave, spots quickly appear in the microwave, which are irresistible at first glance.
01 Nov 2019, 16:57 by M.F.
The microwave oven is a useful household utensil, and inside it, while preparing or heating the dishes, stains are produced that cause a lot of jams. But they really aren't as stubborn as they seem. The right gadgets will be easily overcome.
A mighty lemon
Lemon is indispensable. Pour water into a microwaveable bowl and add the sliced fruit to the slices. Heat all together in the oven and allow the steam to soften the grease stains for a few minutes. Then remove the dishes and wipe the walls. You can use alcohol vinegar instead of lemon. Water and vinegar should be in a one to one ratio. If the stains remain after the first attempt, repeat the process.
Soda and water
Eating soda is also welcome. Shake four tablespoons of dust in two liters of lukewarm water and wipe the oven walls with the mixture. For stubborn stains, use a denser paste and leave it for a few minutes, then rinse and dry the inside of the machine.
